criteria: Explanation of the Importance of Standard Precautions
descriptions: Student does not identify any standard precautions.
Student identifies only one standard precaution.
Student identifies a few standard precautions but misses key elements.
Student identifies most standard precautions with minor omissions.
Student accurately identifies all standard precautions.
Student accurately identifies all standard precautions and provides examples of their application in various scenarios.
Student does not explain why standard precautions are important.
Student provides a vague or inaccurate explanation of the importance of standard precautions.
Student provides a limited explanation of the importance of standard precautions, focusing on one or two aspects.
Student explains the importance of standard precautions, covering several key reasons.
Student clearly and accurately explains the importance of standard precautions, including the prevention of disease transmission.
Student provides a comprehensive and insightful explanation of the importance of standard precautions, including ethical considerations and public health implications.
Student does not demonstrate understanding of universal precautions.
Student confuses standard and universal precautions.
Student shows basic awareness of universal precautions but struggles with specifics.
Student accurately defines universal precautions and explains their relationship to standard precautions.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of universal precautions, including their historical context and evolution into standard precautions.
